comments:
An Error occurs after installing JBoss-IDE-1.5M2.
I audit two scenarious with an unzip to the eclipse home directory with and
without overwriting the EMF and GEF entries.
Then i start the eclipse IDE with the -clean option and get an error, 
when i open a visual class with the editor.
The org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EcoreEList.UnmodifiableEList.FastCompare.class
exists in the org.eclipse.emf.ecore_2.1.0.jar archive.

A re install of VE, GEF and EMF failed too.

Error log:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-07-27 16:45:45.78
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Setup Java Visual Editor".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
org/eclipse/emf/ecore/util/EcoreEList$UnmodifiableEList$FastCompare

Verify that you don't have any errors in the .log file that say something like
"... plugin not installed because plugin already installed... " messages.

This often happens because some other zip (like JBoss maybe) has their own copy
of the same features that we require, but they are not compatible. This can
usually be seen by there being a plugins directory and a plugins jar file that
are the same.

For example, yours here is probably EMF, so see if there is a
plugins/org.eclipse.emf.ecore_2.1.0 directory AND a
plugins/org.eclipse.emf.ecore_2.1.0.jar file. 

If there is, then this is the conflict. The best way to handle it for now is to:

1) have a clean installation of Eclipse, 
2) then unzip JBoss, 
3) Remove any org.eclipse.emf, org.eclipse.gef, org.eclipse.draw2d features and
plugins that may now exist
4) Now unzip emf, gef, and ve.

That should clean it up.

Please let us know if it does.

(In reply to comment #1)

> 4) Now unzip emf, gef, and ve.

Thanks for your fast help,
I found some conflicts with plugins/org.eclipse.emf directory and jar archive.
After a clean install, the problem was solved.
